questions.text: In 1983, NBC aired a weekly TV series titled "The Yellow Rose". What was the Yellow Rose?
options: A special feed the Champion family gave their animals
questions.explanation:
A 200,000 acre ranch.

	"The Yellow Rose" was a ranch outside of San Antonio, Texas run by a former bull rider named Wade Champion. After Wade died, his widow Colleen (Cybill Shepherd) took over running the ranch with Wade's two adult sons, Roy and Quisto. The series first aired on October 2, 1983 and ended its first and final season on May 12, 1984.

questions.text: In the United States, a yellow traffic light signals a driver to behave in what way while driving a car?
questions.correct: Be cautious and/or prepare to stop
options: Pull over and wait for assistance
questions.explanation:
Be cautious and/or prepare to stop.

	An American traffic signal has three lights: red, yellow and green. A red light in America means to stop the car, while a yellow light means to proceed with caution and prepare to stop at any time. A green light means it is safe to drive on. A flashing yellow signal light is a warning light for oncoming traffic. A yellow traffic light has a federal safety minimum of a three second wait time.

questions.text: If Kimberly received a bouquet of yellow roses at her place of employment, what are those yellow roses representing?
questions.explanation:
Friendship.

	In Victorian times, receiving a bouquet of yellow roses would mean someone is jealous of you. In modern times, receiving a bouquet of yellow roses would be a sign of friendship.

questions.text: When Yosemite Sam refers to Bugs Bunny as "yellow-bellied", what is he saying about Bugs Bunny?
options: Bugs Bunny has been painted yellow
questions.explanation:
Bugs Bunny is a coward.

	The phrase "yellow-bellied" is heard often in America, but originates from England. The phrase was used in England as a derogatory term turned at a group of people named the Fens of Lincolnshire. The Fens of Lincolnshire lived in areas that were marshy, causing their skin to have a yellowish cast.

questions.text: What gender is the person with the yellow hat who takes care of Curious George: male or female?
questions.explanation:
Male.

	The Man with The Yellow Hat takes care of Curious George when he brings George home from Africa.  The series was written by children's author H.A. Rey and his wife.  It first began in 1939 and ended in 1966. Curious George is a monkey who gets himself into sticky situations and has to be bailed out by The Man with The Yellow Hat.

questions.text: Who wrote the short story entitled "The Yellow Wallpaper"?
questions.explanation:
Charlotte Gilman.

	Charlotte's short story was written in a two-day span in her home in 1891 and published in 1892. The short story tells of a woman suffering from a mental illness who is kept locked away by her husband. Eventually, the wallpaper in her room causes her mental illness to worsen.

questions.text: Is the sun actually yellow in color?
questions.explanation:
No.

	No, the sun is not actually yellow. The sun is a mixture of colors with different wavelengths. The color yellow has a shorter wavelength, meaning it can make it through the earth's atmosphere easier than other colors with longer wavelengths. Because the color yellow has a shorter wavelength, the sun appears as the color yellow to the human eye.

questions.text: What is the missing word in the Coca-Cola Company's citrus soda: ______ Yello?
questions.explanation:
Mello.

	Mello Yello was first distributed by the Coca-Cola Company on March 1, 1979. It was a competitor for Pepsi's Mountain Dew. The drink originated in New Zealand, and has a faint yellow coloring. A 1980 Mello Yello commercial contained the lyrics: "Look out throat/Watch out tongue/I've got the world's fastest soft drink and here it comes/ Mello Yello makes you feel so good so fast from your head down to your toes/Mello Yello makes you feel so good so fast you just can't drink it slow/Look out lips/watch out toes/I've got another Mello Yello and here it goes/Mello Yello makes you feel so good so fast"

questions.text: In the hemorrhagic disease known as yellow fever, what causes the yellow in the disease's name?
questions.correct: A person with yellow fever develops jaundice
options: The vaccine turns the patient yellow
It was named so as not to be mixed up with black plague
questions.explanation:
A person with yellow fever develops jaundice.

	Yellow fever will rest in a person for three to six days before the person will begin showing symptoms. Ninety percent of all yellow fever cases have been discovered in Africa. A yellow fever vaccine administered within thirty days of contracting the disease is effective in ninety-nine percent cases.
